biography.value: Vânia Proença is a postdoc researcher at the Laboratory of Industrial Ecology and Sustainability at IN+. Her research interests focus on biodiversity change and its links with ecosystem services and human well-being. More specifically, she is interested in biodiversity change driven by farmland abandonment and in the sustainable use of land and ecological restoration of abandoned fields. She was part of the scientific team of the Portugal Millennium Ecosystem Assessment and a co-editor of the final report, and co-authored a report on biodiversity scenarios for the 21st century for the Global Biodiversity Outlook 3, published by the Convention on Biological Diversity.
